body:
Hi @mcsanady, 
I think this is a neat idea I would like to finish my review soon.

Hi @tmgstevens,

Could you please retrigger TravisCI (eg change in a commit message)? It failed because of an unrelated issue which has been fixed since. 

> [ERROR] Failure executing javac, but could not parse the error:
> [ERROR] javac: invalid target release: 1.8
üëç , ship it
Please pull in latest changes from `trunk` first to your feature branch.
In my understanding Jasper is not needed anywhere, however it is a transitive dependency from hadoop   and hadoop is a dependency in some test cases
If it is not needed for our tests then do you think it is worth excluding it from the test scope as well?

The simple jackson.version is for the 1.x from the org.codehaus.jackson group. I kept it because we have transitive dependencies for these artifacts. These usages cannot be merged( different groupId).

The jackson2.version is the 2.x from the com.fasterxml.jackson.core group. This is also for transitive dependencies. The 2 in jackson2 is the mayor version. For me it was self explaining. Do you have any suggestion for the name @simonati ?
@simonati I've changed the version names and added another jackson dependency to the patch. Let me know if it looks ok for you

Thanks @szaboferee! The diff looks good to me. Thanks for making the properties self explain and handling all of the jackson deps (instead of making the change only for jackson-core). I'm running tests of flume now to have a double verification. Will get back to you once it finished.

{{mvn clean install -Dsurefire.rerunFailingTestsCount=5}} fails with 
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project flume-ng-morphline-solr-sink: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.flume.flume-ng-sinks:flume-ng-morphline-solr-sink:jar:1.8.0-SNAPSHOT: Failed to collect dependencies at org.kitesdk:kite-morphlines-all:pom:1.0.0 -> org.kitesdk:kite-morphlines-json:jar:1.0.0 -> com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:jar:2.8.9 -> com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:jar:${jackson2.version}: Failed to read artifact descriptor for com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:jar:${jackson2.version}: Could not transfer artifact com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-annotations:pom:${jackson2.version} from/to com.cloudera.releases (https://repository.cloudera.com/artifactory/cloudera-repos/): Failed to transfer file: https://repository.cloudera.com/artifactory/cloudera-repos/com/fasterxml/jackson/core/jackson-annotations/$%7Bjackson2.version%7D/jackson-annotations-$%7Bjackson2.version%7D.pom. Return code is: 400 , ReasonPhrase:Bad Request. -> [Help 1]
```

I think the problem is caused by the remaining reference to the {{jackson2.version}} property:
```
pom.xml
1119:        <groupId>com.fasterxml.jackson.core</groupId>
1120:        <artifactId>jackson-annotations</artifactId>
1121:        <version>${jackson2.version}</version>
1125:        <groupId>com.fasterxml.jackson.core</groupId>
1126:        <artifactId>jackson-core</artifactId>
1127:        <version>${jackson2.version}</version>
```

Hi @simonati, thanks for testing it, my test runs were successful. It looks like that you had some mix of an earlier version of this pull request, because the version property name is fasterxml.jackson.version and not jackson2.version as in your error message. Also make sure, that you use the proper settings.xml, because the cloudera mirror does not necessarily contains every artifact that is needed for the flume build. 

try with `mvn clean install -Dsurefire.version=2.20 -Dsurefire.rerunFailingTestsCount=5`

> looks like that you had some mix of an earlier version of this pull request,

Indeed that was the case. Thanks!

@szaboferee , thanks for the added test case.
The change looks good to me, üëç

Looks Good To me :+1: 
build with tests was successful.

I removed it from the test scope as well.
the new dependency diff is:
```
71d70
< [INFO]    commons-el:commons-el:jar:1.0:compile
532,536d530
< [INFO]    tomcat:jasper-compiler:jar:5.5.23:runtime
< [INFO]    tomcat:jasper-compiler:jar:5.5.23:test
< [INFO]    tomcat:jasper-runtime:jar:5.5.23:compile
< [INFO]    tomcat:jasper-runtime:jar:5.5.23:runtime
< [INFO]    tomcat:jasper-runtime:jar:5.5.23:test
```

The build with tests was successful

I made some performance testing and the new implementation with the current default settings is much slower.

I will provide a detailed report and some help to reproduce it

The slowness came from a too small default heap size, my measuring results are on the ticket.
Jetty 9 came out better at the end.
Looks Good, Thank you for the patch

@szaboferee : I've noticed that you have reviewed many open PRs. Having a binary or -1/0/+1 comments is great. If you could even provide a short summary why you think the patch is good or bad, that would be even better. If you could also provide a set of criteria based on which you have done the review, that would be the best. Even a single-line summary is helpful. (See https://github.com/apache/flume/blob/trunk/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-to-give-feedback for further information).
Please, let me know what you think.
@bessbd thanks for the suggestion. Next time I will provide that with the simpler code reviews as well.
@frankyaorenjie Thanks again for your contribution! Since the source repository/branch seems to be deleted, do you think that this pull request can be closed? If it is, could you please close it?
@PieterJanVanAeken  Thanks again for your contribution! Since the source repository/branch seems to be deleted, do you think that this pull request can be closed? If it is, could you please close it?
@EdwardsBean  Thanks again for your contribution! Since the source repository/branch seems to be deleted, do you think that this pull request can be closed? If it is, could you please close it?

@guestmetrics Thank you for the contribution! Is this pull request still valid? Is there a chance that you made a JIRA issue for this update?
If this PR is valid and has no JIRA issue, could you please update it and create a ticket with a short decription? 
If the PR is not valid anymore and can be closed, could you please close it?
Thank You!
@szaboferee let's close it, since it has been too long time. And my origin code has already merged into flume.

Hi @Robin021 ,
Thank you for your patch.
The fist commit looks good to me as well, but it seems that you accidentally pushed a new change to this branch/pull request.
If you are fine with it we can push the [first commit](https://github.com/apache/flume/pull/165/commits/83e5719da6be52a86d6318f87d396ef64d294648) to the main branch and close this PR.

I might haven't been clear enough in my previous comment:
I meant that I verified that the test behaves as before your change.
- currently it passes, which is good
- but removing the change which the affected test cases were written for (i.e. #127, commenting out the body of `BucketWriter.recoverLease()`) they fail as expected, so they still test what they are supposed to test
-> the behaviour didn't change indeed.

Yes, please commit the first commit.  
other changes are only customer use of my testing program , will update later. 

thanks!
I ran a test with flume 1.6 and 1.7 as an agent that had a thrift sink connected to an agent running with the new thrift version and the events were transferred successfully

Hi @simonati,

thanks for the review! sure, I will make more consumable tickets and pull requests.
Closing this one.

Hi @HbnKing  
Thank you for the contribution!
 I was wondering if there is a JIRA ticket for this issue that can be mentioned in the title? 

Is this problem reproducible with a unit/integration test? 
If it is, could you also write such a test so we could understand the fix better?

Thank you @szaboferee for the patch, it seems good to me.
The code compiles, tests pass. Thanks for testing the backward compatibility.
üëç 
I'm going to commit this change.
I think we can go with the latest stable release (v.2.9.9) which has the current ([2017b](http://www.iana.org/time-zones)) tz information out of the box.
@marcellhegedus I upgraded to v 2.9.6, because you tested s3 authentication with this version. Could you test this with v2.9.9 too?

Hi Denes,

Right now I don't have a Flume dev environment available. Do you have an estimation on how much of an effort it would be to fix the javadoc issues?


Thanks,

Donat
Is anyone here?
@mcsanady Right. Retested s3 authentication and it also works with joda-time-2.9.9.jar. Thanks for the patch! LGTM +1

Hi @bessbd,
I've created a gist with the error messages without the doclint turned off: https://gist.github.com/adenes/d1ebcf9f5ff3d521bb0ed492017f9288
~600 lines, 3 lines/error -> ~200 errors

Not on insanely huge number but it'd take quite a lot of effort to fix all those, that's why I decided to turn the checks off. I filed a Jira ticket to fix the issues: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLUME-3176
Thank you @mcsanady for the patch and @marcellhegedus for the review, I'm about to commit this.
Trivial fix, looks good to me :+1:
Testing: running jms unit tests. Thank you!
I cannot compile. I get the same error what you can see at Travis Cl build error.

Thanks @mcsanady , I think it worked locally because I already have the flume-checkstyle installed to my local maven repository.
I'm closing this PR and trying to look for other solutions for the packaging issue.

Hi @adenes ,

Slightly off-topic: What exactly is the command you use to generate the source tarball?
I thought, #98 has fixed this issue by removing checkstyle from the source archive generation process.

Thanks,

Donat

`mvn clean install` creates the binary and the source tarball to flume-ng-dist/target and that is uploaded to nexus during `mvn deploy`.
I don't remember clearly what was done during the previous release regarding to the source artifacts. The assembly plugin creates the proper source tarball with the 1.7.0 release, because the checkstyle project was removed.

Should I use the `generate-source-release.sh` script to create the source package and upload it manually to the nexus repository?

Well, if that works and it's to be updated in dev-docs/HowToRelease.md , we should probably do that.
What do you think?
Sure, I'll update the docs, there are some minor fixes to be done.

That sounds awesome!

Thanks, Denes!
Thanks @szaboferee , I have added the .DS_Store to the excludes
Did you check to make sure that checkstyle still works?

Hi @JunLuo ,

Thanks for the pull request!

This looks like a very useful change to me. However, Travis CI has reported a compilation error:

> [ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 
> [INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
> [ERROR] /home/travis/build/apache/flume/flume-ng-channels/flume-redis-channel/src/test/java/org/flume/redis/channel/AppTest.java:[3,22] error: package junit.framework does not exist
> [ERROR] /home/travis/build/apache/flume/flume-ng-channels/flume-redis-channel/src/test/java/org/flume/redis/channel/AppTest.java:[4,22] error: package junit.framework does not exist
> [ERROR] /home/travis/build/apache/flume/flume-ng-channels/flume-redis-channel/src/test/java/org/flume/redis/channel/AppTest.java:[5,22] error: package junit.framework does not exist
> [ERROR] /home/travis/build/apache/flume/flume-ng-channels/flume-redis-channel/src/test/java/org/flume/redis/channel/AppTest.java:[11,12] error: cannot find symbol
> [ERROR]  class TestCase

> /home/travis/build/apache/flume/flume-ng-channels/flume-redis-channel/src/test/java/org/flume/redis/channel/AppTest.java:[36,8] error: cannot find symbol

Can you please fix it, so that we can proceed with the reviews?


Thank you,

Donat

Hi @bessbd ,
I have fixed the errors about Junit and code style :)

Hi @JunLuo ,

Thank you for the changes!

On a first pass, I've noticed that a new user guide entry is missing.
For this change to get merged, some documentation would be necessary.
For an example, I'd recommend [Kafka Channel](http://flume.apache.org/FlumeUserGuide.html#kafka-channel).
Do you think you can make the necessary additions?


Thank you,

Donat

Hi @bessbd ,
I've add some documentation about redis channel :)
Thanks @tmgstevens for the updated patch. The change looks good to me, but I'd like to hear the opinion of other reviewers as well. @szaboferee @mpercy

Hi @szaboferee ,
I've done these changes:
1. Add cluster and sentinel mode
2. Remove useless optional
3. Add the documention about cluster and sentinel
4. Move redis config to flume configuration
5. Fix the error of singleton
6. Add unit test

@mcsanady I removed unnecessary imports and keywords. But I could not find a place to move the getFreePort methods. As far as I can see, there is no module in Flume that all test modules depend on. Should I create a test-utils module?

This also appears in FlumeUserGuide.rst 
I wonder if it is autogenerated, and if it is, how to regenerate.
Um...., I just started reading the Flume source code, really not familiar with the question you raised @mcsanady

@adenes Given Miklos approved the PR, can you please commit?
Thanks

OK, I see, our *.rst files are not generated from the source. Your typo change should be applied too.
So please make this change at flume-ng-doc/sphinx/FlumeUserGuide.rst:4537
Since this change is a "breaking change", please open a jira ticket too, to make it easier to track this change to get it appear in the next release notes.

Agree with @mcsanady on this, we need to track that it might cause problems for exiting users. I assume release notes would be the right place. For that I think the following would be sufficient (afaik flume generates release notes from jira):

0. access to flume jira (https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/FLUME)
1. create a new issue
2. put a label on it indicating that it is a breaking change and 
3. fill out its release notes informing existing adopters what to look for during upgrade

Please let us know if you need any help with it. Generally you need to became a contributor to access the jira which requires subscribing to the dev@ list plus a mail request to the community stating something like "I would like to became a contributor, please grant me access to the jira". It is completely fair to say no at this time if you don't want the associated hassle for this single change but I hope that many more would come so you would have to do eventually.

Tests:
I have uploaded the binary to a cluster, where I could use a configuration with values like this:
agent1.sinks.asynchbase.async.hbase.region_client.inflight_limit = 2

Hi @szaboferee Ôºå
 I've fix all problems you mentions in commits, What should I do next?
Overall, this change looks fine to me. After receiving feedback for the comments I have left, I'd like to request contributors and committers to do a review of this PR so that we can merge it.

Hi @lingjinjiang ,

Thank you for the pull request!

If I'm not mistaken, this change adds new configuration options.
Can you please add the necessary modifications to [FlumeUserGuide.rst](https://github.com/apache/flume/blob/trunk/flume-ng-doc/sphinx/FlumeUserGuide.rst)?


Thank you,

Donat

I think this change is essentially reaching reliability in MemoryChannel when using taildirSource. So the performance diff is essentially the diff of MemoryChannel  and FileChannel. In my tests it saves more than 90% percent of CPU but it's no easy way of comparing it by a simple command.
Perhaps I should add some tests to verify the reliability when using tailDirSource and MemoryChannel?
The extra files have been removed.

@rgoers 
As the first test, I have started a simple test agent with the trunk and with the patch and I see some difference between the log format
before:
`07 nov. 2017 14:25:00,226 INFO  [conf-file-poller-0] (org.apache.flume.conf.FlumeConfiguration$AgentConfiguration.addProperty:930)  - Added sinks: k1 Agent: a1`

after:
`07 Nov 2017 14:25:06,189 INFO  [conf-file-poller-0] (org.apache.flume.conf.FlumeConfiguration$AgentConfiguration.addProperty:930) [] - Added sinks: k1 Agent: a1`

I believe this upgrade should not introduce any change in the default log format.

The format strings are exactly the same. The difference seems to be how %x is handled. In Log4j 1.x the NDC seems to be returned as null if there is nothing, so I am not sure why it is an empty string. In Log4j 2 the ThreadContext Stack returns an empty list which I believe is why you see "[]".  I am curious - Does Flume even use the NDC? Very view applications use the NDC - most use the MDC/ThreadContext Map. A grep of Flume finds the only occurrence of NDC is in the Log4jAppender and that reference only retrieves the NDC from the logging event.

Log4j 2 has a way to handle this so I will give it a try and update the PR when I confirm it is working.

@szaboferee I ran the agent in flume-ng-dist and the results I get don't match yours. With log4j 1.x I got
``07 Nov 2017 23:28:57,156 INFO  [lifecycleSupervisor-1-0] (org.apache.flume.node.PollingPropertiesFileConfigurationProvider.start:62)  - Configuration provider starting``
This doesn't match what you have above. For some reason you have the month as "nov.". I am not sure how you are getting that as the pattern uses "MMM" which is handled by SimpleDateFormat in Log4j 1, which prints Nov as I have here.

Also, based on what you posted above I modified the log4j 2 configuration so that it doesn't print anything if there is no NDC and there is only one space as that is what I see above. However, when I look at the output I get from Log4j 1 I am seeing 2 spaces before the '-'. I noticed that when I include that string here that the double space is being converted to a single space, so I am guessing I really need to modify the pattern to emit 2 spaces when the NDC isn't present instead of just 1.

Are you using the standard conf/log4j.properties in the gzipped tar built by flume-ng-dist? If you are I don't know how you are getting "nov.".

Hi @bessbd ,
I've fix all problems you mentions in commits. :)

Hi @bessbd ,
Thanks for your review.
I have updated the flume user guide.

I have updated the PR again but it can't be merged. It requires Log4j 2.10, which hasn't been released yet, to resolve a ClassNotFound error in Hadoop. The release process for Log4j 2.10 will be starting in the next few days. I will update this PR when it has completed.

The patch has been upgraded to use Log4j 2.10.0. That version includes a version of AppenderSkeleton from Log4j 1 which should eliminate problems with Hadoop. From what I can tell this PR should be ready to go now.
I could run all unit tests successfully.

Bidirectional support came in with version 0.10.2 here is the JIRA tracking references
(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3304) & (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4462)


With this PR, it updates the client to 1.0.0.  We have tested it against a Kafka broker version < 1.0.0
Compatibility matrix can be found here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Compatibility+Matrix

@tmgstevens, @szaboferee 
Can we link this to this issue? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLUME-3197
How do I get the issue on to the board and assign it to me?

Thanks

@tmgstevens - I managed to get all the tests working locally by modifying /etc/hosts.  There is only one test failing as of now  `TestSyslogUtils#TestRfc3164Dates`.  Are you aware of any issues with that test?
I wrote that test and yes, it's failing for me. Probably because it's December (which is a bug). Would you mind raising a JIRA for that and I'll pick it up?
LGTM. Sorry, my bug that one. I was just about to raise a PR for the fix myself!

@szaboferee Could I get your thoughts on https://github.com/tmgstevens/flume/commit/86390d6d0b2e9d0c3d89b5e76275afcbc3672d1c please?

I'd like to avoid us hitting this again, so I've modified SyslogUtils to use a package-private injectable clock and then changed the test so that it "runs" once for each of the next 13 months.
@tmgstevens  I updated this pull request based on your code. Modified a little bit to avoid the static clock and the mutability. Also found  and fixed a small bug in the test at the monthOffset

@tmgstevens I was just about to raise the JIRA and submit a patch, but found this issue here
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLUME-3201, may be related, but sounds like an issue with the code in the TestSyslogUtils#TestRfc3164Dates:201 itself.  Should this line 
`SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("MMM  d hh:MM:ss");` 
be changed to
`SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("MMM dd HH:mm:ss");`

I ran it locally with the change and the tests are passing.  Happy to submit the patch if you are ok.  Let me know.  Thanks
This is a duplicate of pr #155

@harishreedharan 
Can you help me review the change?

Hi @Guangxian ,

Thank you for the PR!

I've taken a look at the change and it seems to be a nice catch!

Even though there might be no concurrent access to the method in the Flume codebase, there might be access "from the outside". Thus, it might be a good idea to make this change in a backwards compatible way. (Ie. extract the "contents" of the method and leave a synchronized read that calls the non-synchronized, new one or something like that.)

Please, let me know what you think.


Thank you,

Donat
@bessbd Thank you for review. I add a `NonSyncResettableFileInputStream` class. Let `ResettableFileInputStream` extends `NonSyncResettableFileInputStream`. Please review it.
@bessbd Can you please review this small patch?
Retest this please

Hi Denes, this patch looks good to me. However this is a breaking API change. Would you mind starting a conversation on the dev list about potentially planning for a Flume 2.0.0 to support this backwards incompatible change?

As I see all tests are passed now. So could you say when this PR will merge?
Thanks

@ssvinarchuk @vegiapparao I'd like to see this committed in time for Flume 1.9, but there's a number of my review comments outstanding, or that haven't been reflected in the latest commits. I'm particularly worried about the change to the KafkaChannel with the dangling ChannelRebalanceListener.

@vegiapparao will you have a chance to make these change?
@tmgstevens yes, I will address your comments very soon.  Sorry about the delay.
When we moved the same file to another directory, and then moved back, making flume does not read the contents of the file repeatedly.
@vegiapparao Do you have time to finish all needed changes to merge this PR?
hi @ssvinarchuk, @tmgstevens - Apologies for the delay.  Stuck with an internal release.  I will work on the changes today, will push them by end of today or early tomorrow.  Sorry again.
